marketNews.title: Bank Credit Growth +9.7% YoY as of Nov 2023, Targeting Double Digit Growth in 2024
marketNews.content:
OJK announced the realization of banking performance as of the end of November 2023. Here are the details:
- Banking credit disbursement grew +0.91% MoM and +9.74% YoY to IDR 6,966 trillion, in line with the target range of +9-11%. This realization was supported by State-Owned Banks which posted credit growth of +12.13% YoY.
- Third Party Funds (DPK) grew to IDR 8,216 trillion (+0.21% MoM, +3.04% YoY), with the deposit segment experiencing the highest growth at +3.5% YoY.
- Net NPL ratio improved to 0.75% (vs. Oct 2023: 0.77%, Nov 2022: 0.75%).
- Gross NPL ratio improved to 2.36% (vs. Oct 2023: 2.42%, Nov 2022: 2.65%).
- Loan to Deposit Ratio (LDR) tightened to 84.78% (vs. Oct 2023: 84.19%; Nov 2022: 78.78%).
The Head of Banking Supervision for OJK, Dian Ediana Rae, stated that credit growth in 2024 is targeted to reach double digits, based on banks' business plans submitted to OJK.
Meanwhile, OJK estimates several banking performance indicators for 2024, with the following details:
- Gross NPL: 2-2.5%
- LDR: 84-86%
- Net profit growth: +9-10% YoY

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway on Liquidity and LDR
marketNews.content:
Key Takeaway: Slower growth in Third Party Funds compared to credit disbursement causes liquidity tightening (increasing LDR), leading to a 'price war' in grabbing DPK (cost of fund increases). This is reflected in the increase in interest expense for the big 4 banks (bank only) during 11M23 YoY, with BBCA +48%, BMRI +54%, BBNI +63%, and BBRI +71%.
We expect the cost of fund to decrease going forward along with the expectation of interest rate cuts. At this time, banks with lower LDR can utilize their liquidity to seize market share. The LDR (bank only) for the big 4 banks in November 2023 was: BBCA 71%, BBRI 87%, BMRI 88%, and BBNI 91%.

marketNews.title: Retail Sales Growth Slowing Down
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that retail sales in Indonesia grew +2.1% YoY in November 2023 (vs. October 2023: +2.4% YoY), marking the sixth consecutive month of growth. Retail sales are projected to grow +0.1% YoY in December 2023.

marketNews.title: OJK Pipeline for Public Offerings
marketNews.content: The Head of Capital Market, Derivative Finance, and Carbon Market Supervision for OJK, Inarno Djajadi, stated on Tuesday (9/1) that there is an 85 public offering pipeline with an indicative value estimate of IDR 28.68 trillion. Of this amount, 60 are plans for new issuer IPOs with a total value of IDR 10.01 trillion.

marketNews.title: Regulation for MSME Credit Write-Off Targeted for Completion in 1H24
marketNews.content: The Head of the Financial Sector Policy Center at the Fiscal Policy Agency, Adi Budiarso, stated that the regulation for MSME credit write-off will be completed in 1H24. Adi mentioned that the regulation will apply to State-Owned Banks which have previously been unable to perform credit write-offs. The regulation will stipulate a specific value for the write-off conducted.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Food and Beverage Industry Targets 5-7% Growth in 2024
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Food and Beverage Entrepreneurs Association (GAPMMI) targets growth performance of +5-7% throughout 2024. The Chairman of GAPMMI, Adhi S. Lukman, stated that certainty in raw material supply makes the national food and beverage industry optimistic about maintaining its growth trend this year.

marketNews.title: OJK Forms Transition Team for Digital Asset and Derivative Oversight Transfer
marketNews.content: OJK is forming a transition team for the transfer of authority to regulate and supervise digital assets and derivatives - including crypto - from Bappebti. Previously, Law No. 4 of 2023 mandated OJK to regulate and supervise crypto asset sector activities by the latest in early 2025.

tickerNews.title: AVIA Already Purchased 7.3% of Total Share Buyback Target
tickerNews.content: AVIA: Avia Avian announced it had repurchased 104.24 million shares as of January 9, 2024. This amount is equivalent to 7.3% of the maximum buyback amount which reaches approximately 1.43 billion (2.3%) shares. This corporate action will continue until June 7, 2025, with an allocation of funds up to IDR 1 trillion.

tickerNews.title: MIDI Reports SSSG Above Target in 4Q23 and Plans to Open New Stores
tickerNews.content: MIDI: Midi Utama Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +6.22% YoY in 4Q23 (vs. 3Q23: +3.99% YoY). Throughout 2023, MIDI's SSSG grew +6.17% YoY, exceeding the management target of +6% YoY. MIDI also announced plans to open 18 new Alfamidi stores in January 2024. This year, MIDI targets an additional 200 new Alfamidi stores.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Achieves 58% YoY New Contract Value Growth in 2023, Exceeding Target
tickerNews.content: ADHI: Adhi Karya recorded growth in new contract value of +58% YoY to IDR 37.4 trillion during 2023, exceeding (138.5%) the FY23 target of IDR 27 trillion. The contribution from the engineering & construction business line reached 93%, manufacturing was 3%, and the remainder from other business lines. Based on funding sources, 44% of the total new contract value came from State-Owned Enterprises or Regional Government-Owned Enterprises, 33% from the government, 14% from loans, and 9% from the private sector.

tickerNews.title: MORA to Issue Sukuk Worth IDR 273.78 Billion for Refinancing and Data Center Investment
tickerNews.content: MORA: Mora Telematika Indonesia will issue sukuk worth IDR 273.78 billion consisting of Series A worth IDR 264.18 billion (reward rate of 10% and 3-year tenor) and Series B worth IDR 9.6 billion (reward rate of 11% and 5-year tenor). The funds will be used for refinancing and investment in building data center backbone and access. The sukuk has received an idA+ (sy) rating from Pefindo.

tickerNews.title: CSRA to Build Third Palm Oil Mill in South Sumatera Worth IDR 160 Billion
tickerNews.content: CSRA: The President Director of Cisadane Sawit Raya, Gita Sapta Adi, stated that the company will build a third palm oil mill worth IDR 160 billion in Banyuasin, South Sumatra. The mill is being built on an area of 2,700 hectares and is targeted to have a fresh fruit bunch processing capacity of 30 tons per hour. Construction financing will come from internal cash and bank loans, while construction is targeted for completion in 3Q25.

tickerNews.title: MLPT Subsidiary VDI Signs IDR 162.61 Billion Loan Facility from Bank Permata (BNLI)
tickerNews.content: MLPT: Multipolar Technology through its subsidiary, PT Visionet Data lnternasional (VDI), signed a loan facility worth IDR 162.61 billion from Bank Permata ($BNLI). The facility has a tenor of 60 months and is intended to support VDI's business activities.

tickerNews.title: GSMF Sells 300 Million BGTG Shares, Reducing Ownership to 33.53%
tickerNews.content: BGTG: Bank Ganesha shareholder, Equity Development Investment ($GSMF), sold 300 million BGTG shares at a price of 83 rupiah per share on January 8, 2023. The total transaction value reached IDR 24.9 billion. After this transaction, GSMF's ownership in BGTG decreased from 34.78% to 33.53%.
